result.execSummary:
The defendant Kristi S. Batien was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Firearm by Felon, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The Court sentences Ms. Batien to pay a fine of $300 + costs = $631 plus $250 DNA surcharge=$881, to be paid in $50 per month installments commencing on 4/1/15 and on the 1st day of each month thereafter until paid in full. Non-payment shall result in a 33 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive.
02-24-2015 The Court orders the Judgment of Conviction be amended to reflect that the defendant must pay costs of $172.26 for officers overtime at the preliminary hearing.

records.addlTxt: Bond Payment Information
Surety Information

Upon deposit of $100.00 and current address information, the Defendant be released from custody, on the above mentioned case.  The Defendant shall pay the remaining balance, plus interest and $15 payment plan fee, at the rate of $50.00/month commencing 05/15/2016.  25% annual increase shall be implemented.  Civil Judgment and referral to the WI DOR, if applicable, shall remain.  Any failure to comply with this payment order shall result in the re-imposition of the failure to pay sentence without further notice of hearing.   Endorsed by the Court on 04/12/2016.

records.addlTxt: with criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.
* FINANCIAL RECORDS *

Reserve Judge Hassin presiding for Branch IV: 
case called at 9:34am. [MK]
Defendant Kristi S. Batien in court with Attorney Jeffrey J De La Rosa.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights given; plea of " Guilty  " entered; factual basis stipulated;  the Court accepts plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

The Court sentences Ms. Batien to pay a fine of $300 + costs = $631 plus $250 DNA surcharge=$881, to be paid in $50 per month installments commencing on 4/1/15 and on the 1st day of each month thereafter until paid in full. Non-payment shall result in a 33 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive.
The Court grants DA Happ's request that the total amount due may be amended to added to include Preliminary Hearing officer-overtime witness costs;  DA Happ is to provide this amount within 14 days.
The Court orders disposal of the subject firearm pursuant to Statute 968.20.
recess 9:41am.
for Hearing Time Change
Status conference on February 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Proposed stip and order for continuance
Status conference on February 20, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
for continuance is granted
Proposed stip for continuance

Clerks Note: This case was scheduled for status conference Defendant Kristi Batien appeared in court. ADA Jeffrey Shock appeared for the State. The Court has recieved a request for continuance because Atty. De La Rosa has been called away on a family emergency. The hearing is rescheduled Ms. Batien indicates that her address has NOT changed.
Status conference on February 5, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
The Court concludes the request is timely and in the proper form. The Court directs the Clerk to request the assignment of another Judge under Wis. Stat. 971.20(8)

case called briefly at 9:04am, and then again at 9: 24am. [MK]
Defendant Kristi S. Batien in court with Attorney Jeffrey J. De La Rosa.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court discloses that in the Court's former capacity as Jefferson County District Attorney, an attorney that DA Wambach supervised did prosecute Ms. Batien.  The Court also knew Ms. Batien's mother on a professional level, through the mother's work as a nurse testified regarding blood draws in OWI cases.  The Court does not feel that any disqualification or recusal is needed.
Attorney De La Rosa requests the scheduling of a Status Conference in approximately thirty days-- this will likely become a change of plea and sentencing.  
The Court verifies with counsel that no speedy trial demand pends. 
recess 9:30am. 
[Post-Hearing: Ms. Batien verifies to the clerk that the Boughton Street address remains current.]

NEXT:  Status Conference (projected plea/sentencing) on 2/5/15 at 2:00pm
Status conference on January 6, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on December 17, 2014 at 11:20 am.

case called at 11:29am. [MK]
Defendant Kristi S. Batien in court with Attorney Jeffrey J De La Rosa.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court vacates its warrant authorization. 
Ms. Batien waives her right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds her over for Trial. 

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charge and maximum penalties recited
--plea of "not guilty" entered
Ms. Batien verifies that the Boughton Street address remains current. 
recess 11:33am. 

NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 12/17/14 at 11:20am (2) schedule Status Conference or other hearing, as Branch III deems appropriate, in Branch III in January

case called at 8:42am. [MK]
Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa in court.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
This case is scheduled for Preliminary Hearing today, however Defendant Kristi Batien does not appear.
Attorney De La Rosa indicates that he spoke with Ms. Batien this morning and learned that she does not believe she received notice of today's hearing. 
ADA Beck indicates that the State is prepared to proceed to Preliminary Hearing today; the officer is here on overtime. 
The Court authorizes issuance of a Bench Warrant, but the Court will stay execution of the warrant until noon to allow Ms. Batien the opportunity to appear voluntarily. 
recess 8:44am.
Pre-trial conference on November 12, 2014 at 10:40 am.
DA routing slip, PTC scheduled for a monday in error, PTC to be rescheduled
Preliminary hearing on November 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on November 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

case called at 1:27pm. 
Defendant Kristi S. Batien in court.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Ms Batien verifies that she heard the Court's recitation of the Right to Counsel and the Constitutional Rights.
Ms. Batien provides the Court with the PD documentation that verifies that she qualifies for PD representation; counsel is being appointed for her. 
On request of Ms. Batien, the Court adjourns the hearing.
Ms. Batien verifies that the 1153 Boughton Street address remains current. 
recess 1:29pm. 

NEXT:  reschedule Initial Appearance on 10/7/14 at 10:00am.
